title.value: Identifying Different Student Clusters in Functional Programming Assignments: From Quick Learners to Struggling Students
title.justification: The title is directly mentioned in the provided text.
title.quote: Identifying Different Student Clusters in Functional Programming Assignments: From Quick Learners to Struggling Students

extractions.description: This research paper analyzes student assignment submission data from a functional programming course. It incorporates various features such as grades, activity time, time spent, and the number of static errors to identify four distinct student clusters: Quick-learning, Hardworking, Satisficing, and Struggling. The study aims to provide insights for both instructors and students to improve learning outcomes and teaching strategies.

type.justification: The paper utilizes data collection and statistical analysis methods to draw conclusions from observed student behaviors and assignment submission data.
type.quote: This paper develops a data-driven approach to better understand studentsâ€™ behavior when solving programming assignments in a functional programming course.

name.justification: The focus is on analyzing educational data to understand student behavior in a programming course.
name.quote: ...our work considers multi-categorical features involving the grade, total time spent on the assignment, and the number of static errors encountered to identify clusters of students.

name.justification: The study involves the use of clustering algorithms to analyze student data and identify patterns.
name.quote: Over the past decade, there have been several studies that focus on identifying groups of students using cluster analysis.

name.justification: The context of the research is within a functional programming course.
name.quote: This research aims to gain a deeper understanding of how students develop typed functional programs (TFP).

name.justification: The dataset involves student assignment submission data collected from a functional programming course.
name.quote: ...we analyze student assignment submission data collected from a functional programming course taught at McGill university incorporating a wide range of features.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset is specific to the study and not referenced from another paper.

name.justification: K-means clustering algorithm was used to identify student clusters.
name.quote: To identify student clusters, we run the K-means[19] clustering algorithm on the aggregation (mean) of three most important features (i.e., grade, number of errors and time spent) over six homework.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to K-means clustering is to the algorithm in general, not a specific paper.
